description.name: SUM(number1, [number2], ...)
description.details: Adds the given numbers together.

parameters.value: Numeric arguments to sum.
Numeric arguments to sum.

description.name: SUBTRACT(number1, [number2], ...)
description.details: Subtract the given numbers together.

parameters.value: Numeric arguments to subtract.
Numeric arguments to subtract.

description.name: MULTIPLY(number1, [number2], ...)
description.details: This function multiplies all the numbers provided as parameters.

parameters.value: The first number or range to be multiplied.
Additional numbers or ranges to be multiplied.

description.name: AVERAGE(number1, [number2], ...)
description.details: Calculates the average of the given numbers.

parameters.value: Numeric arguments for which you want the average.
Numeric arguments for which you want the average.

description.name: MODULUS(number, divisor)
description.details: Returns the remainder after dividing one number by another. It is often used to determine if a number is even or odd, or to perform cyclic operations.
description.example: =MOD(10, 3) returns 1, because when 10 is divided by 3, the remainder is 1.

parameters.value: The number to be divided (the dividend).
The number by which to divide (the divisor).

description.name: CONCATENATE("text1", [text2], ...)
description.details: Joins several text strings into one.

parameters.value: text1, text2… are strings to be joined into a single string
text1, text2… are strings to be joined into a single string.

description.name: LEFT(text, [num_chars])
description.details: Returns the first character(s) from a text string, starting from the left.
description.example: LEFT("Hello World", 5) returns "Hello". If num_chars is not specified, =LEFT("Hello World") returns "H".

parameters.value: The text string from which to extract the characters.
(Optional) The number of characters to extract from the left side of the text. If omitted, it defaults to 1.

description.name: RIGHT(text, [num_chars])
description.details: Returns the specified number of characters from the end of a text string.

parameters.value: The string from which you want to extract the characters.
(Optional) The number of characters to extract from the end. Default is 1.

description.name: MID(text, start_num, num_chars)
description.details: Extracts a substring from a text string, starting at a specified position.

parameters.value: The string from which you want to extract the characters.
The position of the first character to extract (1-based).
The number of characters to return from text.

description.name: UPPER(text)
description.details: Converts a text string to uppercase.

parameters.value: The text string which you want to convert text to uppercase.

description.name: LOWER(text)
description.details: Converts a text string to lowercase.

parameters.value: The text string which you want to convert text to lowercase.

description.name: PROPER(text)
description.details: Capitalizes the first letter of each word in a text string.

parameters.value: The text string in which you want to capitalize the first letter in each word.

description.name: TODAY()
description.details: Returns the current date as per local system date format.
description.example: TODAY() might return 08/08/2024 if today's date is 8th August 2024.

description.name: NOW()
description.details: Returns the current date and time based on your system's date & time format.
description.example: NOW() might return 08/23/2024 12:20 pm based on your system's date time format

description.name: DAY()
description.details: Returns the day part from a given date.

parameters.value: Input date from which the day will be extracted
Desired output format.(Optional- If parameters are not specified, then, the current date will be used.)

description.name: MONTH()
description.details: Returns the month part from a given date.

parameters.value: Input date from which the month will be extracted
Desired output format.(Optional- If parameters are not specified, then, the current date will be used.)

description.name: YEAR()
description.details: Returns the year from a date.

parameters.value: Input date from which the year will be extracted
Desired output format.(Optional- If parameters are not specified, then, the current date will be used.)

description.name: HOUR()
description.details: Returns the hour from a given time string.

parameters.value: Input time string (Optional – If parameter is not specified, then, the current time will be used.)

description.name: MINUTE()
description.details: Returns the minute from a given time string.

parameters.value: Input time string (Optional – If parameter is not specified, then, the current time will be used.)

description.name: SECOND()
description.details: Returns the second  from a given time string.

parameters.value: Input time string (Optional – If parameter is not specified, then, the current time will be used.)

description.name: SPLIT(text,delimiter,index)
description.details: Splits a string using the specified delimiter and returns the value at the given index (0-based).
description.example: SPLIT("Hello,World,Excel", ",",1) splits the text "Hello,World,Excel" into three parts: "Hello", "World", and "Excel",and will return "world"

parameters.value: The text string to split.
The character or string used to divide the text.
The position of the part to return (1-based). For example, 1 returns the first part, 2 returns the second part, and so on.

description.name: CREDIT_CARD_CVV("Country name")
description.details: Generates a credit card CVV code based on the specified country.

parameters.value: The country code for which to generate the CVV code.

description.name: CREDIT_CARD_NUMBER("Country Name)
description.details: Generates a credit card number based on the specified country.

parameters.value: The country code for which to generate the card number.

description.name: CURRENCY_CODE("country name")
description.details: Returns the currency code for the specified country.

parameters.value: The name of the country for which to get the currency code.

description.name: CURRENCY_NAME("country name")
description.details: Returns the currency name for the specified country.

parameters.value: The name of the country for which to get the currency code.

description.name: CURRENCY_SYMBOL("country name")
description.details: Returns the currency symbol for the specified country.

parameters.value: The name of the country for which to get the currency code.

description.name: COUNTRY_NAME()
description.details: Returns a random country name.

parameters.value: Continent Name based on which the country name will be retrieved.(Optional - if parameter not specified, then random country name will be returned)

description.name: COUNTRY_CODE("country name")
description.details: Returns the country code for the specified country.

parameters.value: The name of the country for which to get the country code.

description.name: CITY("state name")
description.details: Returns a name of a city randomly based on the entered country name. Parameter: country name - The name of the country for which you want to retrieve city information
description.example: city("france") might return the value as Paris

parameters.value: State name based on which City name would be returned.(Optional- If parameter not specified, then, a random city will be returned.)

description.name: FIRST_NAME(country name,sex,min,max)
description.details: Generates a first name based on the specified country and sex.

parameters.value: The name of the country.
The gender for the name ("Male" or "Female").
The minimum length of the name.
The maximum length of the name.

description.name: LAST_NAME(country name,sex,min,max)
description.details: Generates a last name based on the specified country and sex.

parameters.value: The name of the country.
The gender for the name ("Male" or "Female").
The minimum length of the name.
The maximum length of the name.

description.name: FULL_NAME(country name,sex,min,max)
description.details: Generates a full name based on the specified country and sex.

parameters.value: The name of the country.
The gender for the name ("Male" or "Female").
The minimum length of the name.
The maximum length of the name.

description.name: MIDDLE_NAME(country name,sex,min,max)
description.details: Generates a middle name based on the specified country and sex.

parameters.value: The name of the country.
The gender for the name ("Male" or "Female").
The minimum length of the name.
The maximum length of the name.

description.name: PREFIX(sex)
description.details: Returns a prefix (Mr., Mrs., etc.) based on the specified sex.

parameters.value: The gender for which to get the prefix ("Male" or "Female").

description.name: PHONE_NUMBER("country name")
description.details: Generates a phone number based on the specified country.

parameters.value: The name of the country for which to get the phone number.

description.name: TIMEZONE("country name")
description.details: Returns the time zone for the specified country.

parameters.value: The name of the country for which to get the timezone.

description.name: STREET("country name")
description.details: Returns a street address for the specified country.

parameters.value: The name of the country for which to get the street.

description.name: ADDRESS("country name")
description.details: Returns a complete address for the specified country.
description.example: =ADDRESS("United States") might return "123 Main St, Springfield, IL, 62701".

parameters.value: The name of the country for which to get the full address.

description.name: STATE("country name")
description.details: Returns a postal code for the specified country.

parameters.value: The name of the country for which to get the state.

description.name: ZIPCODE("country name")
description.details: Returns a state/province for the specified country.

parameters.value: The name of the country for which to get the zipcode.

description.name: Date of Birth - DOB(dd/mm/yyyy, start, end)
description.details: Generates a date of birth based on the given format and age range.

parameters.value: Desired output date format (e.g., "dd/MM/yyyy")
Minimum age of the person.
Maximum age of the person.
If parameters are not specified, then, a random format and age within default ranges will be used.

description.name: =ReadFromExcel([file-path], [sheet-name], [cell-reference])
description.details: Fetches data from the specified Excel file during test execution. The fetched value is used as test data for the parameter.

parameters.value: The path to the Excel file. Can be a local file path or a repository path. Supports parameterization.
The name of the sheet in the Excel file to read from. Supports parameterization.
The reference to the cell (e.g., A1, B2) whose value needs to be fetched. Supports parameterization.

description.name: ONCE(Formula)
description.details: Ensures that a dynamic formula is evaluated only once per test case execution. The result remains constant throughout the execution, and a new value is generated on subsequent executions. =ONCE() is invalid for static values (e.g., =ONCE("John")). It supports various dynamic formulas like FIRSTNAME(), LASTNAME(), EMAIL() etc and parameterization with {{...}}.
description.example: =ONCE(=FIRSTNAME("India")) generates a first name once during the test run and retains the value until the test is executed again.

parameters.value: The dynamic formula to be evaluated. Can include functions like FIRSTNAME(), EMAIL(), etc. Supports parameterization with {{...}}.

description.name: EMAIL([prefix], [domain], [format])
description.details: Generates a realistic email address based on prefix, domain & format.

parameters.value: String used as the username for email.
Domain name for the email address. (E.g.: simplify3x.com)
